title: Q22 Grammar MC
prompt: Which of these sentences is grammatically correct?
feedback:
The correct answer is: “The chemical reactions in the battery cause electrons to build up at the anode, or negative terminal.”

In the sentence “The anode are a negatively charged (-) terminal; the cathode are a positively charged (+) terminal,” the subjects are singular, but the verbs are plural. The subjects and verbs don’t match. Similarly, in the sentence “This create an electrical charge,” the subject is singular and the verb is plural. The correct verb is “creates.”

In the sentence “The electrolyte is being the area between the anode and the cathode,” the verb should simply be “is.” The construction “is being” is incorrect.
